intro: Vernonia quangensis, commonly known as the Quang Ngai Vernonia, is a flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-green in color. Vernonia quangensis is of interest to botanists due to its potential ecological role and limited distribution.
